description.narrative: (Georgia): Momavlis Taoba aims to promote greater civic engagement among young people and to expand and institutionalize secondary school civic education curricula through practical applications. The program works with and supports the Ministry of Education and Science (MES) and other stakeholders to expand the reach of civic education activities to 480 schools (20 percent of all Georgia's schools) throughout the country, improving the quality and scope of school-based civic education as a means to positively influence the knowledge, attitudes and behaviors of youth as active participants in Georgia's democratic society. During the next year, activities will continue working closely with MES officials and Civic Education Department staff to advance their skills and lead the national civic education efforts..With FY 2017 funds, Momavlis Taoba will continue to conduct trainings for civic education teachers and civic club students, support capstone "service-learning" projects as part of the in-school curricula and/or through school-based civic clubs. Activities will also continue support of the Civic Education Teachers' Forum in offering professional development opportunities to civic teachers.
